repnme.cdata!:
China - Guangdong Agricultural Development
            Project and Earthquake Reconstruction Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Guangdong Agricultural Development
            Project and Earthquake Reconstruction Program's overall
            outcome is viewed as satisfactory, since the most important
            objectives of agricultural growth and development, and
            poverty alleviation were achieved with a relatively high
            degree of sustainability. The main lessons learned are: a)
            keep the project design simple; b) ensure proper
            institutional arrangements are in place for complex
            projects; b) allow flexibility in project design and
            activities adjustment; d) ensure procurement arrangements
            are in line with project design and planning; e) encourage
            proven technology transfer; f) involve the private sector in
            agroprocessing; g) ensure beneficiary participation; and h)
            plan the replication of project activities.

728382.trustfund: TF020930-NEW ZEALAND CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF032883-CHINA - AGRICULTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Guangdong Agricultural Development
            and Earthquake Reconstruction Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project was
            highly satisfactory. The key lessons convey that the
            sustained project management successfully implemented the
            program, through the involvement of leading groups at the
            Provincial, Prefecture, and County levels, who supported
            full time management offices, thus, greatly enhancing relief
            operations. Likewise, the consistent involvement of local
            communities in reconstruction efforts, in both Inner
            Mongolia and the Yunnan Province, was an important
            participatory factor towards a satisfactory long-term
            sustainability. Furthermore, the adoption of simplified
            procurement procedures had a definite and positive impact on
            the efficiency of the program, with satisfactory compliance
            rates, even when on occasions, the lowest bid was rejected
            in lieu of high-quality work. Regardless of success, it is
            suggested that appropriate financial tracking systems should
            be in place at project inception, thus, avoiding
            implementation delays and/or sanctioning of expenditures,
            particularly for emergency lending. In addition, early
            availability of funds could be essential to address disaster
            repairs in a timely fashion.

18157318.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
18157318.theme: Land administration and management,Other rural development,Rural non-farm income generation,Social safety nets
18157318.trustfund: TF020830-SUDANO SAHELIAN ZONES IN AFRICA,TF020930-NEW ZEALAND CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF032883-CHINA - AGRICULTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
18157318.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the project are to:
            (i) increase fish production in the 100-250 m depths of
            South China Sea, thus relieving pressure on near-coastal
            resources; (ii) develop coastal mud flats and low-lying land
            for aquaculture; (iii) increase production of fruits on
            sloping land; (iv) bring new land into agricultural
            production and improve river flow conditions in the Pearl
            River delta; and  provide modern agroindustrial facilities
            for handling and processing. To achieve these objectivess
            the project proposes: (1) provision of 86 fishing vessels;
            (2) construction of about 4,000 ha of ponds and 11,000 cages
            for aquaculture; (3) improvement of 10,700 ha and
            establishment of 3,300 ha of orchards on uncultivated hilly
            lands; (4) land reclamation works for improvement and
            expansion of 6,500 ha of surgarcane; (5) establishment of
            agroprocessing facilities to utilize locally available raw
            materials; and  (6) a poverty alleviation package comprising
            studies, infrastructure and development loans for households
            and village groups in a recognized poverty area.
